articles.title: Cecil: The Lion and the Dentist review – inside the horrific big cat killing that outraged the world
articles.description: This documentary looks at the 2015 slaying of the majestic head of two lion prides in Zimbabwe, by a trophy-hunting American dentist. Sadly it raises more questions than it answers

more.title: Zimbabweans abroad dismiss Ziyambi’s claim that diaspora voting depends on constitutional amendment
more.description: The Zimbabwe Diaspora Vote Initiative (ZDVI) has dismissed claims by Justice Minister Ziyambi Ziyambi that Zimbabweans living abroad will only be able to vote after the passage of the Constitutional Amendment Bill No. 3 of 2026, saying the two issues are unrelated. This comes after Ziyambi a few days ago indicated that diaspora voting would [...]The post Zimbabweans abroad dismiss Ziyambi’s claim that diaspora voting depends on constitutional amendment appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Constitutional Court throws out bid to overturn PVO Act
more.description: The Constitutional Court of Zimbabwe has dismissed an application seeking to invalidate the Private Voluntary Organisations Act 2025 and hold the President of Zimbabwe accountable for allegedly assenting to a law passed without proper public participation, ruling that no constitutional breach was established. In a judgment handed down on 16 February 2026, Justice Rita Makarau [...]The post Constitutional Court throws out bid to overturn PVO Act appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: ZNCC woos Korean companies to exhibit locally
more.description: THE Zimbabwe National Chamber of Commerce (ZNCC) recently engaged the Embassy of Korea in a development that is likely to see companies from the East Asian nation exhibiting at forthcoming events. An update shared by the Chamber confirms that ZNCC president Tapiwa Karoro and the chief economist Jephias Makiwa held an engagement with the Embassy [...]The post ZNCC woos Korean companies to exhibit locally appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Chinese firm Livetouch ordered to pay US$380k to transporter in long-running debt saga
more.description: Chinese investment firm Livetouch Investments (Private) Limited has been ordered to pay US$380,000 to Avim Investments (Private) Limited after the High Court of Zimbabwe ruled that the former had no lawful authority to oppose the urgent application, a finding that cleared the way for immediate enforcement. Justice Regis Dembure confirmed an ex tempore ruling issued [...]The post Chinese firm Livetouch ordered to pay US$380k to transporter in long-running debt saga appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: It’s hard to meet someone like him – iShowSpeed says Superstar Jani was highlight of his Africa tour
more.description: A month after coming to Zimbabwe as part of his African tour, American YouTuber iShowSpeed is still smitten by his doppelganger, Mudiwa ‘Superstar’ Jani, whom he described as a highlight of the continental expedition. Jani’s breakthrough came when the YouTube streamer visited Mbare as part of the Harare tour. The encounter became the highlight of [...]The post It’s hard to meet someone like him – iShowSpeed says Superstar Jani was highlight of his Africa tour appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.description: Offence exposed after victim allegedly kidnapped toddler in central Bulawayo Source: Kombi driver jailed 3 years for sexually abusing child kidnap teen – Zimbabwe News Now Jailed Godwell Mumba BULAWAYO — A kombi driver who sexually abused his ex-girlfriend’s 14-year-old sister has been sentenced to three years in prison after his crime was exposed through [...]The post Kombi driver jailed 3 years for sexually abusing child kidnap teen appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: Tobacco farmers push for decentralisation of auction floors
more.description: Source: Tobacco farmers push for decentralisation of auction floors – herald Edgar Vhera, edgar.vhera@zimpapers.co.zw FARMERS have urged the Tobacco Industry and Marketing Board (TIMB) to decentralise tobacco auction floors by operationalising the Tobacco Value Chain Transformation Plan 2 (TVCTP 2), covering the period 2026 to 2030. This emerged during a recent stakeholders meeting in Harare to [...]The post Tobacco farmers push for decentralisation of auction floors appeared first on Zimbabwe Situation.

more.title: NO MERCY EVEN FOR COPS IN CRACKDOWN
more.description: Source: NO MERCY EVEN FOR COPS IN CRACKDOWN – herald Arron Nyamayaro POLICE are not sparring anyone when it comes to their crackdown on rogue elements on the country’s roads.
